Yol (The Way) Yilmaz Guney 

A Turkish classic from 1982.

IBDM Says:
A harsh portrait of Turkey, its people and its authorities, shown through the stories of five prisoners given a week's home leave, and the problems they encounter in adjusting to the world outside.

I says:
This very masculine film centres around the themes of freeedom and compulsion. It is a classic from a politicaly aware Turkish director.
